intro: Paraboea romklaoensis, commonly known as the Thai mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically features heart-shaped leaves and produces vibrant blue or violet blooms. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
